body_html:
By the way, there are quite some failures on Jenkins due to:

docker: Error response from daemon: devmapper: Thin Pool has 981366 free data blocks which is less than minimum required 983040 free data blocks. Create more free space in thin pool or use dm.min_free_space option to change behavior.

I don't know enough about the infrastructure platform of TensorFlow for Jenkins servers, though I would suggest to take a look at overlay2 storage driver (vs. devmapper).

The overlay2 is considered as mature as of now. On most of the Linux platforms it probably would be better performant than devmapper.

There might be issues with REHL 7's SELinux for overlay2 but that may have been fixed as well. For other Linux kernels most likely overlay2 would be better.

If the docker version on Jenkins is newer enough then overlay2 probably will be an option to consider.

body:
By the way, there are quite some failures on Jenkins due to:
```
docker: Error response from daemon: devmapper: Thin Pool has 981366 free data blocks which is less than minimum required 983040 free data blocks. Create more free space in thin pool or use dm.min_free_space option to change behavior.
```

I don't know enough about the infrastructure platform of TensorFlow for Jenkins servers, though I would suggest to take a look at overlay2 storage driver (vs.  devmapper). 

The overlay2 is considered as mature as of now. On most of the Linux platforms it probably would be better performant than devmapper.

There might be issues with REHL 7's SELinux for overlay2 but that may have been fixed as well. For other Linux kernels most likely overlay2 would be better.

If the docker version on Jenkins is newer enough then overlay2 probably will be an option to consider.
